item.title: Apple's Common Crypto Library Defaults to a Zero IV if One is not Provided
item.description: Today I was writing some guidelines about generating keys for mobile applications at work. While providing code examples in Java and Obj-C for AES encryption I happened to look at Apple's [Common Crypto] CCLink library . While going through the source code for [CommonCryptor.c] CCLink2, I noticed that IV is commented as /* optional initialization vector */. This makes sense because not all ciphers use IV and not all AES modes of operation (e.g. ECB mode). However; if an IV is not provided, the library will default to a zero IV.
